net.allwebdesign.common.lib.db
Class DataHandler

java.lang.Object
  net.allwebdesign.common.lib.db.DataHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
GenericDataHandler
public abstract class DataHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Datahandler is an abstract class that needs to be extended in the applications It acts as a wrapper class for accessing the core DAO.

Version:
1.0
Author:
George Moraitakis

runSproc

public DataResults runSproc(java.lang.String sprocName,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args,
                            java.lang.Object... staticArgs)
Runs a sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type rowXX_paramName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
Returns:
the results of the sproc

runSproc

public DataResults runSproc(java.lang.String sprocName,
                            java.lang.String flag,
                            java.lang.String delim,
                            java.lang.String row,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args,
                            java.lang.Object... staticArgs)
Runs a sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type flag0delimparamName (e.g. testrow0_). It also assumes that the param symbol is @

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
flag - the flag of the rows to use (e.g. row)
delim - the delim of the rows to use (e.g. _)
argSymbol - the symbol to use for the sproc param (typically @)
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
Returns:
the results of the sproc

runSproc

public DataResults runSproc(java.lang.String sprocName,
                            java.lang.String flag,
                            java.lang.String delim,
                            java.lang.String row,
                            java.lang.String argSymbol,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> args,
                            java.lang.Object... staticArgs)
Runs a sproc with arguments constructed from the keys of the arguments passed (typically form params) and additional args. It assumes the form params are of the type flagrowdelimparamName.

Parameters:
sprocName - the sproc name
flag - the flag of the rows to use (e.g. row)
delim - the delim of the rows to use (e.g. _)
row - a specific row number to use. If null then assumes 0 (e.g. row0_).
argSymbol - the symbol to use for the sproc param (typically @)
args - the map of arguments
staticArgs - static args (e.g. \@param = 1234)
Returns:
the results of the sproc

runInsertTable

public void runInsertTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           boolean ignoreId,
                           boolean ignoreRecTimestamp,
                           java.lang.Object... values)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
It directly inserts into a table without the need to write sql. The table definition is loaded once from the db and stored into cache
Also, for convenience you can ignore the id column (if it is an identity column) and the rectimestamp (if it inserts default timestamps)

Parameters:
tableName - the table to do insert into
ignoreId - to ignore the Id column (you must set to true if this is Identity or Sequence column)
ignoreRecTimestamp - to ignore the RecTimestamp if this is what you want (e.g. when this column has a default)
values - the values to insert into each field. WARNING! The have to be in the same order as the table definition
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do insert

runInsertTable

public void runInsertTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Inserts the data of map into a table. Assumes the rows have the format rowX_[column name]

Parameters:
tableName - the table to insert into
dataMap - the map the keys of which are the columns to restrict insert. The rest will be null or default (WARNING! do not omit any non-null column)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do insert

runInsertTable

public void runInsertTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.lang.String flag,
                           java.lang.String delim,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Runs an automated insert to a table with arguments constructed from the keys of the datamap passed (typically form params). The method uses the flag and delim to parse the arguments required and sorts them alphabetically.
Following that, the table columns are sorted alphabetically and the two are combined to create the insert statement By default it will ignore the Id column

Parameters:
tableName - the table to insert into
flag - the row flag e.g. row
delim - the delimiter e.g. _
dataMap - the map the keys of which are the columns to restrict insert. The rest will be null or default (WARNING! do not omit any non-null column)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do insert

runInsertTable

public void runInsertTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.lang.String flag,
                           java.lang.String delim,
                           java.lang.String row,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Runs an automated insert to a table with arguments constructed from the keys of the datamap passed (typically form params). The method uses the flag and delim to parse the arguments required and sorts them alphabetically.
Following that, the table columns are sorted alphabetically and the two are combined to create the insert statement By default it will ignore the Id column

Parameters:
tableName - the table to insert into
flag - the row flag e.g. row
delim - the delimiter e.g. _
the - row to grab
dataMap - the map the keys of which are the columns to restrict insert. The rest will be null or default (WARNING! do not omit any non-null column)
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do insert

runTableSelect

public DataResults runTableSelect(java.lang.String tableName,
                                  java.lang.String selectWhereSql,
                                  java.lang.Object... selectWhereParams)
Runs a simple select * from a table using a custom where clause

Parameters:
tableName - the table to use
selectWhereSql - the custom where clause. If null it reverts to dbShowRecords and shows all records
selectWhereParams - the params to pass to where clause. If the latter is null there have no effect
Returns:
the records of the table selected
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there was a problem to run the query

runUpdateTableWithHist

public void runUpdateTableWithHist(java.lang.String tableName,
                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Will run a table update for a row included in the dataMap. You have the option to put the data in a history table named [tableName]Hist before updating.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to update
dataMap - dataMap the map containing the data
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do the update

runUpdateTable

public void runUpdateTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Will run a table update for a row included in the dataMap with the name rowX_Id. Assumes the row has the format rowX_

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to update
dataMap - the map containing the data
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do the update

runUpdateTable

public void runUpdateTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.lang.String historyTableName,
                           java.lang.String flag,
                           java.lang.String delim,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Will run a table update for a row included in the dataMap. You have the option to put the data in a history table before updating.

Parameters:
tableName - the name of the table to update
historyTableName - the name of the history table name
flag - the row flag e.g. row
delim - the row delimiter e.g. _
dataMap - the map containing the data
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if it was unable to do the update

runBatchInsert

public void runBatchInsert(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Batch Insert data into a table from a data map containing fields in the form row[0-9]_[fieldName]

Parameters:
tableName - the table name to insert into
dataMap - the data map containing the values. The keys must be of the form row[0-9]_[fieldName] and the fieldName match the table fields
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if not able to insert

runBatchInsert

public void runBatchInsert(java.lang.String tableName,
                           java.lang.String flag,
                           java.lang.String delim,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Batch Insert data into a table from a data map containing fields in a specifiv format [flag][0-9][delim][fieldName]

Parameters:
tableName - the table name to insert into
flag - the row flag e.g. row
delim - the row delimiter e.g. _
dataMap - the data map containing the values. The keys must be of the form [flag][0-9][delim][fieldName] and the fieldName match the table fields
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if not able to insert

runBatchReplaceWithHist

public void runBatchReplaceWithHist(java.lang.String tableName,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap,
                                    java.lang.String delWhereSql,
                                    java.lang.Object... delCriteria)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Replaces the data of a table with new one based on criteria. It will copy the replaced data to a history table named [tableName]Hist

Parameters:
tableName - the table to use
dataMap - the data map containing the new data (typically the data of a form). Must contain keys of the form row[0-9]_[dataField]
delWhereSql - a partial sql without the where keyword to select the data to replace and to which the values are passed
delCriteria - the fields passed to the delWhereClause
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the replace does not work

runBatchReplace

public void runBatchReplace(java.lang.String tableName,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap,
                            java.lang.String delWhereSql,
                            java.lang.Object... delCriteria)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Replaces the data of a table with new one based on criteria. The replaced data are lost

Parameters:
tableName - the table to use
dataMap - the data map containing the new data (typically the data of a form). Must contain keys of the form row[0-9]_[dataField]
delWhereSql - a partial sql without the where keyword to select the data to replace and to which the values are passed
delCriteria - the fields passed to the delWhereClause
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the replace does not work

runBatchReplace

public void runBatchReplace(java.lang.String tableName,
                            java.lang.String historyTableName,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> dataMap,
                            java.lang.String flag,
                            java.lang.String delim,
                            java.lang.String delWhereSql,
                            java.lang.Object... delCriteria)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Replaces the data of a table with new one based on criteria. Optionally it can copy the replaced data to a history table

Parameters:
tableName - the table to use
historyTableName - the history table to put data in. If null then it will not store the replaced data
dataMap - the data map containing the new data (typically the data of a form)
flag - the row flag in the data map e.g. row
delim - the delimiter of the rows e.g. _
delWhereSql - a partial sql without the where keyword to select the data to replace and to which the values are passed
delCriteria - the fields passed to the delWhereClause
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the replace does not work

dbShowRecords

public DataResults dbShowRecords(java.lang.String table)
Shows all records of a table

Parameters:
table - the table name
Returns:
the data

dbFetchRecordById

public DataResults dbFetchRecordById(java.lang.String table,
                                     java.lang.String id)
Fetches a record by its Id

Parameters:
table - the table name
id - the id of the table (the field must be named Id)
Returns:
the data

dbFetchSpecificRecords

public DataResults dbFetchSpecificRecords(java.lang.String table,
